research interests.summary: I am interested in problems at the intersection of Deep Learning and Information Theory. My current research focuses on developing ultra-low rate image compression schemes based on vision foundation models.

work.name: Apple
highlights: Tabular generative models for synthetic data generation to model rare scenarios.
Developed and trained a diffusion-based foundation model for RF calibration, focusing on synthetic data creation to model failures at the receiver.
Reduced data collection needs by over 10x through the use of high-quality synthetic tabular datasets.
Improved regression performance by training on synthetic data, achieving ~22% reduction in MSE.

work.name: Samsung Research America
highlights: Sequence modeling for design of polar codes with Transformers using policy gradient methods.

work.name: Qualcomm Research India
highlights: Developed and deployed multiple transceiver algorithms for next-generation WiFi chipsets.

publications.name: DeepPolar: Inventing Nonlinear Large-Kernel Polar Codes via Deep Learning
publications.publisher: Proceedings of International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML)
publications.summary: Proposes DeepPolar, a method to invent nonlinear large-kernel polar codes using deep learning techniques. This approach outperforms traditional polar codes in terms of error-correcting performance.
publications.authors: Ashwin Hebbar, Sravan Ankireddy, Hyeji Kim, Sewoong Oh, Pramod Viswanath

publications.name: Task-Aware Distributed Source Coding Under Dynamic Bandwidth
publications.publisher: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)
publications.summary: Introduces a task-aware approach for distributed source coding in dynamic bandwidth environments. Utilizes deep learning to optimize bandwidth usage and improve coding efficiency.
publications.authors: Po-han Li, Sravan Ankireddy, Ruihan Philip Zhao, Hossein Nourkhiz Mahjoub, Ehsan Moradi Pari, Ufuk Topcu, Sandeep Chinchali, Hyeji Kim

publications.name: Exploring Explainability in Video Action Recognition
publications.publisher: 3rd Explainable AI for Computer Vision (XAI4CV) Workshop at CVPR
publications.summary: Explores explainability techniques for video action recognition models. Proposes novel visualizations and explanations to understand model decisions.
publications.authors: Avinab Saha, Shashank Gupta, Sravan Ankireddy, Karl Chahine, Joydeep Ghosh

publications.name: Nested Construction of Polar Codes via Transformers
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 2024 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory (ISIT)
publications.summary: Presents a method to construct nested polar codes using Transformer models. Demonstrates performance improvements over conventional polar codes.
publications.authors: Sravan Ankireddy, S. Ashwin Hebbar, Heping Wan, Joonyoung Cho, Charlie Zhang

publications.name: Compressed Error HARQ: Feedback Communication on Noise-Asymmetric Channels
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 2023 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory (ISIT)
publications.summary: Proposes a compressed HARQ feedback mechanism for noise-asymmetric channels. Achieves better reliability and lower overhead than traditional HARQ.
publications.authors: Sravan Ankireddy, S. Ashwin Hebbar, Yihan Jiang, Pramod Viswanath, Hyeji Kim

publications.name: Interpreting Neural Min-Sum Decoders
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 2023 IEEE International Conference on Communications (ICC)
publications.summary: Provides insights into neural min-sum decoders by analyzing their decision-making process. Proposes a method to interpret these models for better transparency.

publications.name: TinyTurbo: Efficient Turbo Decoders on Edge
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 2022 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory (ISIT)
publications.summary: Proposes TinyTurbo, an efficient turbo decoding method designed for edge devices. Demonstrates low latency and reduced resource usage.
publications.authors: S. Ashwin Hebbar, Rajesh K Mishra, Sravan Ankireddy, Ashok V Makkuva, Hyeji Kim, Pramod Viswanath

publications.name: LightCode: Light Analytical and Neural Codes for Channels with Feedback
publications.publisher: IEEE Journal on Selected Areas in Communications (JSAC)
publications.summary: Introduces LightCode, a hybrid analytical and neural code for channels with feedback. Achieves performance gains over existing feedback codes.
publications.authors: Sravan Ankireddy, Krishna Narayanan, Hyeji Kim

publications.name: Learning RL-Policies for Joint Beamforming Without Exploration: A Batch Constrained Off-Policy Approach
publications.summary: Develops a reinforcement learning approach for joint beamforming without exploration, using batch-constrained off-policy methods to optimize performance.

research projects.name: Ultra Low-Rate Neural Image Compression
highlights: Developed an ultra-low rate (<0.1 bpp) compression framework leveraging vision foundation models.
Designed a novel cross-attention aggregation technique to improve the alignment between input image and reconstructed image using textual captions as side information.
Improving realism-fidelity trade-off in reconstruction using RLHF guidance and preference datasets.

research projects.name: Synthetic Datasets using Tabular Generative Models
highlights: Developed and trained a diffusion-based foundation model for RF calibration, focusing on synthetic data creation to model failures at the receiver.
Reduced data collection needs by over 10× through the use of high-quality synthetic tabular datasets.
Improved regression performance by training on synthetic data, achieving ∼22% reduction in MSE.

research projects.name: Improving In-Context Learning (ICL) in LLMs using Structured Noise
highlights: Developed techniques to enhance ICL performance by improving the separation of demonstrations.
Proposed a method to select the optimal separator by analyzing perplexity for each demonstration.
Formulated an explanation for the empirical observations using Bayesian inference.

research projects.name: Data Augmentation using Generative Models
highlights: Explored parameter-efficient fine-tuning methods for text-to-image models for data augmentation.
Demonstrated gains of up to 3.4% in classification accuracy by augmenting the true datasets with synthetic images generated using low rank approximation (LoRA) with DreamBooth.

research projects.name: Construction of Polar Codes using Sequence Modeling
highlights: Modeled Polar code construction as a sequential decision making problem and designed a nested construction technique using transformer models and policy gradient methods.
Demonstrated significant gains (up to 0.8 dB) compared to patented Polar code in 5G-NR standards.

research projects.name: Task-Aware Variable Rate Compression of Distributed Sources
highlights: Designed distributed representation learning algorithm to optimize compression for downstream tasks.
Proposed a dimensionality reduction technique to encourage low-rank representations, allowing variable-rate compression using a single model.
